headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: The Fourth In America; CNN Presents "The Fourth In America", An Independence Day Special. Aired 10-11p ET

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: You can feel the excitement in Nashville. We're taking a live look at downtown where people are packed in, anticipating the fireworks that are set to kick off soon.We're back with CNN's Fourth in America. We actually want to take you now to Nashville with CNNs John Berman, who has done a bit of everything tonight, taking Jack Daniels shots, he's wearing that amazing in patriotic vest. And what do you got there, John?

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: He's got milk, so it looks spicy.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: So, first of all, I'm here with a couple of hundred thousand of my closest friends getting ready for the fireworks now. And Nashville, as you guys know, is known for a few things, like the hot weather was pushing 100 today, the hot music, we've been hearing it all night, and the hot chicken, which is here in front of me right now. I did this in the wrong order, right? The whiskey first and I'm having my meals second, hot chicken right here.The old story goes generations ago, a wife was trying to the cause her husband pain, so she made particularly hot chicken to cause some discomfort. The problem was he liked it enough an empire was born. Okay. So, the national underground may be their famous hot chicken. We have mild, medium, hot and ring of fire over here. And just so you know, ring of fire is not exactly after the June Carter song. It's where the physical effects that may linger for some time after you eat this. I'm going to skip over the mild and I'm going to write to medium here. And one thing you need to know about me, what I like --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: No, no. How crazy high, come on? Come on?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I am like Captain Happen. The medium I can handle. It's like a six on the spicy scale, vaguely unpleasant but manageable.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Step it up.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Hot, hot, okay, but this is not at all pleasant right now. I don't feel good.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Drink the milk.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: But let me skip right to ring of fire for you.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Take the bite, Berman.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: The milk is only when if I make it through this. Ring of fire, I'm always doing this because it sweeps.All right, that's hot. That's really hot.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: You found it, yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Good, man. Good, man.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: This is not necessarily for human consumption. I'll bring them home for you. Happy Fourth.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: An incredible performance of that song by Keith Urban. His new album, "High", is set to be released on September 20th.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Although I have to say, that song is my favorite, Keith Urban song. Just fantastic. I'm so glad he sang it tonight. Coming up, we have another extraordinary firework show over a city that is closely tied to America's birthday -- Boston. Plus, we'll get the party rocking with music from the band, The Killers. And later, rap star T- Pain performs his hits. This is "The Fourth in America".(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Take a look at this scene in Texas. It's Austin's turn to light this July 4th up. Welcome back to our coverage of holiday fireworks and red hot music all across the nation.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Let's bring in our colleagues, Victor Blackwell and Sara Sidner in San Diego. Victor, I see you. Where's Sara?

utterances.speaker: VICTOR BLACKWELL, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Guys, I know I have a co-host, but she has been all over the place. Let me see if I can -- Sara, what are you doing on a jet ski?

utterances.speaker: SARA SIDNER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Hey, I mean, it's San Diego Bay, what else are you going to do? I was having a little bit too much fun, so I'm going to come join you in just a minute. You know, I cannot wait for this --500,000 people going to watch this, but you know what, maybe I'll watch it from the bay, Victor. I think I'm going to watch it from the bay. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: Okay, at some point, you've got to come up here with me.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: All right. I will come up there with you, but for right now, I'm going to have a little fun.

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: Go have your fun.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: See you.

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: So, while Sara's having fun out on the bay, listen guys, we have a huge show when you come out west. REO Speedwagon, T-Pain, Bleachers, Goo Goo Dolls, not to mention the fireworks. We've got them from San Francisco and Houston and New Orleans. We're taking you to Guam for the first time on this show, Alaska, and the Big Bay Boom here over San Diego Bay, the biggest fireworks show on the west coast.When the sun goes down, the sky's about to light up, we're going to have a party starting at the top of the hour, and maybe, maybe I can get my co-host off the jet ski and she can come back and join me.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: No way. She's having too much fun circling behind you. She's such a badass.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: What a terrific performance by The Killers. Make sure to catch them in their upcoming residency at Caesars Palace, Vegas, beginning on August 14th. That was great.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: I could listen to that song every single day --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It's a classic. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: -- for the rest of my life. It's a classic. Just a quick shout out to my sister-in-law, Juliana. This is her first July 4th since becoming a U.S. citizen.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: You know that was wonderful. All I can think about is getting my grub on though in the fourth of July, to be honest.

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: Listen, and in Nashville, we got John Berman there with wings and whiskey and that fantastic hat. Look at this show. I mean it's unbeatable in Nashville. We had great fireworks in Nashville. Simultaneously, a fantastic show in Boston and we've got more coming throughout the night.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: We are going to show out here though because San Diego puts on an amazing show. It's the largest in the west coast.

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: So, and beautiful you cannot beat the weather. Now, I know they've got wings and hot chicken --

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: They do.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: -- and all that stuff in Nashville and good country music, but they do not have this beauty, this weather. Every single day, it's like 70.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: And we have to remember, people love the fourth of July here. You've got Naval Bay San Diego, you've got 48,000 sailors and personnel.

utterances.speaker: BLACKWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.
